title: Impact of Interactive Learning Environments and Metacognitive Support on Learning Outcomes in Online Education

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service teachers to develop online instructional design capabilities for elementary mathematics education

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to design mathematical problem-solving using metacognitive strategies in synchronous/asynchronous environments.

In an online learning environment (Google Classroom, Zoom Breakout Rooms, etc.), the learner uses interactive tools (discussion boards, real-time feedback systems) to develop at least three instructional design scenarios (e.g., flipped learning, collaborative learning) and achieves an 80%+ suitability score in peer and expert reviews.
Propose strategies to reduce transactional distance (TD) by applying learner-centered metacognitive support.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
